annotation.TEXT: Yes, I could've just fallen there for the normal exit, but there's still stuff I want to show off in the second half of the level later, and I wanted to keep midpoint active for then.
May as well stock up on flowers while I'm here, but I still want to keep one feather.
That unlocks Perplex Rosa 2. Huh, that's weird. There seems to be some sort of puddle along that path that Mario is swimming through.
There's a huge chunk of ? blocks here. I'll show off how to hit all of them later. For right now, I'm just gonna go down this pipe into a bonus room!
Collect all 10 coins over here (it looks like there's only 8, but 2 are hidden below the screen). Then, fly straight up to get out of there.
Sweet! Now, I just gotta do the trick again to hit the other two columns.
Okay, now let's see if I can get this to work. Doing it this way is the most reliable way I can think of to block clone to the right here.
Oh, shut up, clock!
And now that I've got a blue Yoshi, I can collect previously unreachable stuff in a couple earlier levels!
There, and now that I have an extra key, I don't need the shells anymore.
Sorry, I don't kno w why this co ins are puprle. They just are.
But, now I'm trapped, so I gotta Start+Select out. Bye, Yoshi!
Oh, man, I sucked! It's probably because I had too much moon pie earlier. Oh, well. It's not like I need any more lives!
Hi, Yoshi! Now, let's grab some coins! Make sure to get all of them, or else certain people's OCDs will start acting up!
And now, for the rest of Rosa Perplex 1...
Now, to stomp this red 3-1, it's easier to scroll the screen like this, rather than do some tricky flying maneuver. (Thanks go to addax12345 for showing me this.)
Also, blue Yoshi can certainly eat this shell and use it to fly around.
Okay, good! Go! Go!
Oh, I need to go back for something. Wait there for a moment, Yoshi!

By the way, I know I messed up the name of this level's boss last time. He's actually called "enemy", not "Iggy". He looks and acts just like Iggy, though. Must be his long-lost identical twin or something...
Okay, now with this 3-1 shell, I can block clone the key block!
You might remember these six golden coins from before. Well, they may not open up a castle, but I'm still gonna get them!
Gulp! That's okay! I got all the coins, and can just Start+Select out! (You can also fly straight up to get out of there if Yoshi hasn't swallowed yet.)
On to the other level with buried treasure!
Yes, got it on my first try! Now quick, get on Yoshi and get the wings!
Alright, there we... go...
Wait... What if I were to try... THIS!!!
Hold left and Y or X as you blast off at the start, and you'll land right on a cloud platform above. It's very handy for getting to the coins and the Yoshi block quickly!
Also, I'll need to place Yoshi in the right spot for this as well.
Well... I guess you will crash into that para3-1 anyway if you have Yoshi. Okay, I did not know that. So, if you have Yoshi, you probably will want to adjust your flight path there.
They're even better if dug up with a parasol. However, you don't want to eat too much at once, or you might get sick. If you don't have more than four servings in one meal, you should be alright.
(Wow, did I not die at all in this episode? Well, maybe next episode will be different...)
GAAAMMME!!!
MOOOONNNS!!! ...Huh, but what? I cant get any of them?! NOOOOO!!! This... this cannot be!
Also, it's common courtesy to cape spin the digger and any leftovers afterwards.
Now, thanks to these falling feathers, the earlier power ups are totally unnecessary! (If you really want flowers for some reason though, you can always go back for them after finishing the combo.)

And, now to make the other 3-1 respawn so I can stomp him and finish the combo. Oops! He's jammed in the wall. I'm guessing I should jump off the fence to stomp him so I don't get hurt, just like with that other jammed guy.

276-life combo! Note: That corner clip was TAS-ed (and it took me like 15 minutes of attempts before I finally got it). Also, SuperSupermario24 found that image online somewhere, and I added the moons to it.
Next, let's hope you left a 3-1 alive nearby.
Ah, good. I did leave one over here alive. Now, I think there are only red 3-1s in this level, but one red 3-1 should be plenty for this.
And, there you have it. A 6-life combo! (Zeldara109 had already posted a video of this combo, but I wanted to come back here for the capes anyway, so I figured I might as well do this too.)
Aw, man! If only I had a P-switch... Then it would be easy to get them. But, unfortunately, I don't think there are any P-switches in this level...
This method ensures that I'll have no horizontal momentum, which screws up sideways block cloning for some reason.
However, block cloning it to the left doesn't do much good. I need to block clone it to the right for what I want, but there's no solid ground on the right side. So, first, I'll block clone up.
Gulp!
Whoa. I was expecting to dive bomb there, but whatever. I got what I needed.
Now, to properly set up a rightward block clone, I'll just adjust the key like so...
First, eat up a non-red 3-1 from anywhere, and bring it over to the pit covered with turn blocks from before.
Now, as any Yoshi connoisseur will tell you, freshly dug up Wiggler's legs have a taste that can't be beat!

Now, before I get back to Rosa Perplex 1, I want to return to fight against enemy for a couple reasons. Oh, and by the way, the winner of the kooper/duder naming is 3-1 this time! All the votes are listed in the video description.
Get rid of the Gourmet chef here, as I'm not hungry right now, and he might get in the way. However, don't kill this 3-1. He's vital to hitting those ? blocks.

Now, an interesting thing to note here: Even though I grabbed all of these Yoshi coin "halves" before, they're back again now. Every time you revisit this level, you can come up here and grab them for an extra life (and 15000 points, which don't really mean anything)!
Gulp! Whoa, I cut that kind of close.
Nuts.
Now, remember these buried coins? Well, now that I have a blue Yoshi, they're reachable!
Okay, got it, and kill the 3-1 so he doesn't disco dance the shell through the floor this time!
Make sure to watch out for the fireball as you go through this gate!
Whoops! Hey, Yoshi, get back here!
Now, looking at all these signs, I think I should head in a certain direction... Maybe... right?
Hey, Lakitu, can you give me a boost? Thanks!
This is probably how you're meant to hit these turn blocks over here, so you don't end up dying.
Now, like I said before, if you don't touch anything when you launch from midpoint here, you won't crash into- What?!
Alright, now with those two levels fully completed, let's go back and do the rest of Rosa Perplex 1!
And, with the power of a 3-1 and my blue Yoshi, I will get an awesome score from this block this time!
Interesting... I overshot, but that para3-1 jumped anyway! Man, they scare easily!
First I need this guy... Hi, Yoshi!
Hidden Easter egg: The mole holes spell out "FPI" down here. Also, you can hit a few turn blocks while flying down here.

Now, for this 3-1... Oh, he didn't spawn. Let me fix that. Now, for him, if you didn't duck jump onto the fence at the start, you'll probably have to take a hit to reach him without breaking the combo (unless you're already small).
Now's not the time to be stumbling!
Now, you may remember one of my videos from long ago where I showed that you can make a shell become glitchy if Yoshi takes a hit while his tongue is on it. That's what I intend to do here.
Nuts. Well, I'm not getting a perfect this time...
Whatever. Now back to Rosa Perplex 1 to hit those ? blocks I didn't hit last time.
Then I need to quickly make my way to near the end of the level...
Now, if I position myself correctly here and kick the shell, it should be able to clean out two columns of these ? blocks.

Now, be careful. If you fly too low, you'll die, and if you fly too high, you might end up back above the ground, or worse, crashing into a foe that's walking on the ground! (You wouldn't want to lose your blue Yoshi now!)
Don't bother with the power ups here if you're already super, even if you could use them. It's very tricky to collect a flower without accidentally landing on its block, which would break the combo.
Nuts.
Then, bring it back here and use it (along with a cape or a shell), to clear out the blocks from under these pipes.
Next time, I'll be heading to Perplex Rosa 2, finally. To be continued...
Afterwards, try not to accidentally fly back above the ground like I did, but don't go too low either. Make your way to the left and hopefully you can grab the coins before Yoshi swallows!
It's a bit more complicated this time though. First, go to the end of the level and get the P-switch.
Hello, and welcome back to yet another episode of Chaos CompleXX!
By the way, if you're unable to get the blue Yoshi trick to work in Rosa Perplex 1, don't panic. There'll be at least one easier opportunity to get a blue Yoshi later on.
Break at least one turn block to open up this pit, spit out the shell and slurp it up again to reset Yoshi's "Gulp!" timer, then fly into the pit and to the right.
However, because of my past Yoshi coin collecting, I won't find any here, so I'll just Start+Select out now.
LOL, that 3-1 decided to climb into the muck there! (I don't think I noticed that last time.)
Then, make your way to the right, stomping the stompable 3-1s as normal for now.
Now, over here is where a 3-1 despawned on me last time. That's why I thought that a 5-life combo was the maximum at first. I'll make him respawn in a moment.

Here's the tricky part. Feed the red shell to Yoshi, and then park him right next to the pipes. Then, quickly duck under the pipes and try to line yourself up so that you can duck jump onto Yoshi while still hitting your head on the pipes.
D'oh!
Okay, got it! This shell is now glitchy. If I kick it normally, it'll go through the floor, and anything else solid that's below it, but it can still hit and bounce off of objects to its sides.
Now, as it turns out, a 6-life fence 3-1 stomping combo is possible here! Start off by duck jumping onto the fence. This'll be helpful later.
Remember to jump off the fence to stomp the jammed green 3-1, or else you'll be the one taking damage.
There's got to be some way to reach them though...
Okay, back here. Now, there's this chunk of ? blocks, but in my current state, I can only hit some of the outer blocks. I'll need to come back again later to get the rest.
There, now I'm just gonna go grab Yoshi and get out of here.
Also, this is interesting: These two Yoshi coins reappeared for some reason! But, not all of them reappeared. I know there used to be one under the multi-coin block over here.
Of course, this may take a few tries.
It's mayhem, mayhem, mayhem! (Do we really need all those "mayhems"?)
Awesome! Now I've reached a very well-hidden bonus area! It's basically a copy of a bonus area from the original SMW.
Oh, goodie! There's the goal. Note that the goal tape goes slightly higher than the top of the goalposts, so be aware of that. Now, can I get at least one star?
YES, YES!!! I managed to get at least one star! Now, I can finally go to the bonus game!
And now, to resume Rosa Perplex 1!
